decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing low-cost creatures and disruption spells to control the board while applying pressure with efficient creatures. Plagon, Lord of the Beach serves as the commander, providing additional card advantage and late-game potential. The deck includes a mix of counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak, along with disruptive creatures like Drannith Magistrate and True-Name Nemesis to disrupt opponents' strategies. It also includes versatile cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Teferi, Time Raveler to provide additional utility and flexibility. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to establish early control of the game through disruption and efficient creatures, leading to a strong aggressive finish.

The deck revolves around using Atraxa, Grand Unifier to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and manipulating the board state. With a combination of counterspells like Cryptic Command and Force of Will, removal spells like Fatal Push and Swords to Plowshares, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own. The deck also aims to draw cards and manipulate its own library with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Demonic Tutor to ensure consistent access to its powerful spells. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until victory is inevitable.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using the partner commanders Bruse Tarl and Yoshimaru in a Duel Commander format. It includes a variety of efficient creatures and spells to apply pressure on the opponent, such as Adeline, Resplendent Cathar, Lightning Bolt, and Goblin Bombardment. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy with cards like Arid Mesa and Mana Confluence. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Skullclamp and Shadowspear enhances the creatures' abilities to push for damage quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on with a relentless assault, utilizing the synergy between the commanders and the aggressive cards included in the deck.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures and utilize burn spells to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on early aggression with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Sprite Dragon, supported by cheap removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. It also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of efficient creatures and versatile spells, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon to punish opponents who rely heavily on nonbasic lands.

The deck focuses on utilizing Malcolm, the Eyes to aggressively control the game through a combination of disruptive spells and efficient creatures. By maximizing the use of spells like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Force Spike, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while advancing its own game plan. The inclusion of cards like Gitaxian Probe, Peek, and Thought Scour help to draw into needed answers while also providing information about opponents' hands. The deck also includes a selection of versatile creatures like Brazen Borrower and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure on opponents while still being able to interact with spells in the graveyard. Through a combination of disruption and aggression, the deck aims to control the game and secure a victory.
